intro: Chelidonium vernale, commonly known as spring celandine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the poppy family (Papaveraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, often in moist environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a distinctive reddish or orange coloration. Chelidonium vernale is known for its medicinal properties, though it contains toxic alkaloids and should be handled with care.
